items.title: jQuery lives on; major changes teased
items.content:
#â€‹639 â€” May 18, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Bun's New Bundler: 220x Faster than webpack? â€” Bun is one of the newest JavaScript runtimes (built atop the JavaScriptCore engine) and focuses on speed while aiming to be a drop-in replacement for Node.js. This weekâ€™s v0.6.0 release is the â€˜biggest release yetâ€™ with standalone executable generation and more, but its new JavaScript bundler and minifier may attract most of the attention and this post digs intoÂ why.

Jarred Sumner

ğŸ¤” If you'd prefer to read what a third party thinks, Shane O'Sullivan gave the new bundler a spin and shared his thoughts. There's also some discussion on HackerÂ News. It's early days and while esbuild may be fast enough for most right now, it's fantastic to see any progress in bundling.

Deopt Explorer: A VS Code Extension to Inspect V8 Trace Log Info â€” A thorough introduction to MS's new tool for performing analysis of the V8 engineâ€™s internals, including CPU profile data, how inline caches operate, deoptimizations, how functions were run (interpreted or compiled) and more. Thereâ€™s a lot goingÂ on.

Ron Buckton (Microsoft)

Supercharge Your Websites and Applications with Cloudflare â€” Get ready for supercharged speed and reliability with Cloudflare's suite of performance tools. With ultra-fast CDN, smart traffic routing, media optimization, and more, Cloudflare has everything you need to ensure your site or app runs at peakÂ performance.

Cloudflare sponsor

jQuery 3.7.0 Released â€” JavaScript Weekly is 638 issues old, or almost 13 years once you take away weeks off, so jQuery was a big deal in our early days. We hold a lot of nostalgia for it, and it remains widely used even if no-one is writing about it anymore ğŸ˜† v3.7 folds the Sizzle selector engine into the core, adds some unitless CSS properties, gains a new uniqueSort method, and â€œmajor changesâ€ are still promised in future. jQuery livesÂ on!

Timmy Willison (jQuery Foundation)

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • TC39's Hemanth.HM has begun keeping a list of ES2023 code examples like he did for ES2022, ES2021, and ES2020.

  • ğŸ¤” The New Stack has a story about Meta supporting the OpenJS Foundation â€“ but who wrote the article is what we found more interesting..

  • The folks at Meta / Facebook have written about the efficiency gains made in Messenger Desktop by moving from Electron to React Native.

  • One downside to platforms like Cloudflare Workers using V8 isolates has been a lack of support for opening TCP sockets â€“ quite an impediement if you want to talk to a RDBMS over TCP or something. Fear no more, Cloudflare Workers has introduced a connect() API for creating TCP sockets from Workers functions.

  • Promise.withResolvers progressed to stage 2 at the latest TC39 meeting.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js 20.2

  • Rome 12.1
    â†³ The formatter/linter gains stage 3 decorator support.

  • Ember.js 5.0 â€“ App framework.

  • Jasmine 5.0 â€“ Testing framework.

  • Gatsby 5.10

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

How to Get Full Type Support with Plain JavaScript â€” Itâ€™s possible to reap the benefits of TypeScript, yet still write plain JavaScript, as TypeScriptâ€™s analyzer understands types written in the JSDocÂ format.

Pausly

TypeScript's own JS Projects Utilizing TypeScript page has more info on the different levels of strictness you can follow from mere inference on regular JS code through to full on TypeScript with strict enabled.

â–¶Â Â Coding a Working Game of Chess in Pure JavaScript â€” No canvas, either. All using the DOM, SVG, and JavaScript. No AI and itâ€™s not perfect, but itâ€™s only 88 minutes long and itâ€™ll give you something toÂ workÂ on..

Ania Kubow

Automate Slack and MS Teams Notifications Using Node.js â€” Quick guide to send and automate messages via Slack, MS Teams, and any other channel from your Node.jsÂ applications.

Courier.com sponsor

Your Jest Tests Might Be Wrong â€” Is your Jest test suite failing you? You might not be using the testing frameworkâ€™s full potential, especially when it comes to preventing state leakage betweenÂ tests.

Jamie Magee

A Guide to Visual Regression Testing with Playwright â€” The Playwright browser control library can form the basis of an end-to-end testing mechanism all written in JavaScript, and comparing the visual output of tests can help show where things are goingÂ wrong.

Dima Ivashchuk (Lost Pixel)

Create a Real Time Multi Host Video Chat in a Browser with AmazonÂ IVS

Amazon Web Services (AWS) sponsor

React Server Components, Next.js App Router and Examples â€” Addy Osmaniâ€™s overview of of the state of React Server Components, the Next.js App Router implementation, other implementations, the move towards hybrid rendering, plus relatedÂ links.

Addy Osmani

..and if React is your thing, the latest issue of React Status is for you.

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

VanJS: A 1.2KB Reactive UI Framework Without JSX â€” A new entrant to an increasingly crowded space, VanJS is particularly light and elegant, and its author has put some serious effort into documenting it and offering tools to convert your HTML to its custom format. Itâ€™s short for vanilla JavaScript, by the way.. GitHubÂ repo.

Tao Xin

JavaScript Scratchpad for VS Code (2m+ Downloads) â€” Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring/testing JavaScript with edit-continue experience to see realtime execution and runtimeÂ values.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Introducing Legend-State 1.0: Faster State for React â€” Another state management solution? After a year of effort, Legend State 1.0 claims to be the fastest option â€œon just about every metricâ€ and they have the benchmarks to prove it. Whatever the case, this thorough intro is worth a look. GitHubÂ repo.

Mooâ€¤do

Starry Night: GitHub-Like Syntax Highlighting â€” Apparently, GitHubâ€™s own syntax highlighting approach isnâ€™t open source, but this takes a similar approach and is. Itâ€™s admittedly quite 'heavy' (due to using a WASM build of the Oniguruma regex engine) but thatâ€™s the price ofÂ quality.

Titus Wormer

Garph 0.5: A Fullstack GraphQL Framework for TypeScript â€” Full-stack â€˜batteries includedâ€™ GraphQL APIs without codegen. GitHubÂ repo.

Step CI

headless-qr: A Simple, Modern QR Code Library â€” A slimmer adaptation of an older project without the extra code that isnâ€™t necessaryÂ today. Turning the binary into an image is your job, or use something like QRCode.js if you want a canvas-rendered QR code out of the box.

Rich Harris

Scroll Btween: Use Scroll Position to Tween CSS Values on DOMÂ Elements â€” Scrolling/parallax libraries tend to feel the same but this one demonstrates some diverse examples with colors, images, and text â€” all with noÂ dependencies.

Olivier Blanc

eslint-plugin-check-file: Rules for Consistent Filename and FolderÂ Names â€” Allows you to enforce a consistent naming pattern for file and directory names inÂ projects.

Huan

  • Transformers.js 2.0 â€“ Run Hugging Face transformers directly in browser.

  • PrimeReact 9.4 â€“ Extensive UI component library.

  • The Lounge 4.4 â€“ Cross-platform, self-hosted web IRC client.

  • Faast.js 8.0 â€“ Serverless batch computing made simple.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

Fullstack Engineer at Everfund.com â€” Push code, change lives! Help us become the center for good causes on the modern web with our devÂ tools.
Everfund

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

ğŸ˜Â Go with the flow..

js2flowchart.js â€” A visualization library to convert JavaScript code into attractive SVG flowcharts. Luckily, thereâ€™s a live online version if you want to play without having to installÂ anything.

Bohdan Liashenko

items.title: Why Svelte is converting TypeScript to JSDoc
items.content:
#â€‹638 â€” May 11, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The JavaScript Ecosystem is Delightfully Weird â€” There are plenty of examples of how JavaScript is weird but Sam focuses on the why. If youâ€™ve been a JS developer for many years youâ€™ll have seen it go through many phases and morph to fit its environment. Sam paints the big picture, concluding with a talk Dan Abramov gave yesterday called â€œReact from AnotherÂ Dimension.â€

Sam Ruby

The New JS Features Coming in ECMAScript 2023 â€” The next JavaScript update brings smaller additions familiar from other languages, but there are more significant developments waiting in theÂ wings.Â 

Mary Branscombe (The New Stack)

Full Stack for Front-End Engineers with Jem Young (Netflix) â€” Learn what it means to become a well-rounded full-stack engineer with this hands-on video course. Youâ€™ll dive into servers, work with the command line, understand networking and security, set up continuous integration and deployment, manage databases, build containers, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Vue 3.3 'Rurouni Kenshin' Released â€” Named after a popular manga series, the latest release of Vue is focused on developer experience improvements, particular for those usingÂ TypeScript.

Evan You

John Komarnicki says â–¶ï¸ Vue 3.3's defineModel macro will change the way you write your components.

Next.js 13.4 Released â€” Despite the minor version bump, this is a big release for the popular React framework. The new app router and its improved approach to filesystem based routing is now offered as a stable feature, with a new concept of server actions being introduced in alpha as a way to mutate data on the server without needing to create an in-between APIÂ layer.

Tim Neutkens and Sebastian MarkbÃ¥ge

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ«¢ Svelte is converting from TypeScript to JSDoc (example).. sort of. Rich Harris popped up on Hacker News to provide some all important context but the ultimate result will be smaller package sizes and a better experience for Svelte'sÂ maintainers.

  • React now has official 'canary' releases if you want to use newer features than in the stable releases but still be on an officially supportedÂ channel.

  • Newly released Firefox 113 lets you override JS files in its debugger.

  • No stranger to controversy, Ruby on Rails's David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH) tweeted: ğŸ¦ "TypeScript sucked out much of the joy I had writingÂ JavaScript."

RELEASES:

  • Glint 1.0 â€“ TypeScript powered tooling for Glimmer / Ember templates.

  • Elementary 2.0 â€“ JS/C++ library for building audio apps.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

ES2023's New Array Copying Methods â€” The newest ECMAScript spec introduces some new methods on Array that youâ€™ll eventually find useful in your own programs. Phil gives us theÂ tour.

Phil Nash

Private Class Fields Considered Harmful â€” â€œAs a library author, Iâ€™ve decided to avoid private class fields from now on and gradually refactor them out of my existing libraries.â€ Why? Well, thatâ€™s the interestingÂ part..

Lea Verou

â–¶Â Â I'm Done with React â€” Going from least-to-most important, the reasons this developer isnâ€™t choosing React for future projects make for interesting watching, particularly if you too are overwhelmed by upheaval in the React world. Solid is one of the alternatives he has warmedÂ to.

Adam Elmore

Constraining Language Runtimes with Deterministic Execution â€” Explore various challenges encountered while using different language runtimes to execute workflow codeÂ deterministically.

Temporal Technologies sponsor

Running JavaScript in Rust with Deno â€” Denoâ€™s use of Rust makes it a natural choice if youâ€™re building a Rust app and want to integrate a JavaScriptÂ engine.

Austin Poor

Regular Expressions in JavaScript â€” Powerful but often misunderstood, many will benefit from this roundup of the potential regexes offer to JavaScriptÂ developers.

Adebayo Adams

How to Measure Page Loading Time with the Performance API â€” The Performance API is a group of standards used to measure the performance of webapps supported in most modernÂ browsers.

Silvestar BistroviÄ‡

How to Build a JS VST or Audio Unit Plugin on macOS â€” VSTs and Audio Units are both types of audio plugins for audio editing software and they're usually built in C or C++. This tutorial doesnâ€™t dig into the audio side of things, but more the practicalities of packaging things up to getÂ started.

Chris Mendez

An Introduction to the Bun Runtime â€” If youâ€™ve not yet played with the newest entrant into the JS runtime space, this is a high levelÂ overview.

Craig Buckler

2023 State of the Java Ecosystem

New Relic sponsor

Configuring ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript Together
Josh Goldberg

DestroyRef: Your New Angular 16 Friend
Ion Prodan

Why Astro is My Favorite Framework
Ryan Trimble

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

file-type 18.4: Detect the File Type of a Buffer, Uint8Array orÂ ArrayBuffer â€” For example, give it the raw data from a PNG file, and itâ€™ll tell you itâ€™s a PNG file. Uses magic numbers so is targeted solely at non text-basedÂ formats.

Sindre Sorhus

Learn How the Rising Trend of Malicious Packages Can Affect YourÂ Apps â€” Keep your applications secure with Snykâ€™s article on the increasing number of malicious OS packages and ways to mitigate theseÂ risks.

Snyk sponsor

Livefir: Build Reactive HTML Apps with Go and Alpine.js â€” Go isnâ€™t a language that often pops up in the context of the frontend, but this is a neat integration between Go on the backend and Alpine.js upÂ front.

Adnaan Badr

JZZ.js: A Developer Friendly MIDI library â€” For both browsers and Node, JZZ.js provides an abstraction over working with MIDI related concepts. There are many examples, but the easter egg in the top left is ourÂ favorite.

Sema / Jazz-Soft

htmlparser2 9.0: A 'Fast and Forgiving' HTML and XML Parser â€” Consumes documents and calls callbacks, but it can generate a DOM as well. Works in both Node andÂ browser.

Felix BÃ¶hm

cRonstrue: Library to Convert cron Expressions into Human-ReadableÂ Form â€” Given something like */5 * * * *, it'll return â€œEvery 5 minutesâ€. NoÂ dependencies.

Brady Holt

Knip: Find Unused Files, Dependencies and Exports in TypeScriptÂ Projects â€” Being Dutch for â€œsnipâ€ is appropriate as Knip can trim away things that arenâ€™t being used in yourÂ project.

Lars Kappert

  • jsPlumb 6.1
    â†³ Visual connectivity for webapps.

  • gridstack.js 8.1
    â†³ Build interactive dashboards quickly.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

Team Lead Web Development â€” Experienced with Node, React, and TS? Join us and lead a motivated team of devs and help grow and shape the future of our web app focused on helping millions explore theÂ outdoors.
Komoot

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

ğŸ¤«Â Don't tell Satya Nadella..

Fake Windows 11 in Svelte â€” This is a cute little side project, and the code is available too. The most common complaint Iâ€™ve seen is that itâ€™s actually more responsive than the real Windows.. ğŸ˜† Be sure to check out both â€˜VS Codeâ€™ and â€˜Microsoft Edgeâ€™ in thisÂ environment.

Yashash Pugalia

ğŸ Prefer Windows XP? Maybe RebornXP is more for you. Complete with the classic startingÂ upÂ sound!

JZZ.js: A Developer Friendly MIDI library â€” For both browsers and Node, JZZ.js provides an abstraction over working with MIDI related concepts. There are many examples, but the easter egg in the top left is ourÂ favorite.
Sema / Jazz-Soft 


  
  
htmlparser2 9.0: A 'Fast and Forgiving' HTML and XML Parser â€” Consumes documents and calls callbacks, but it can generate a DOM as well. Works in both Node andÂ browser.
Felix BÃ¶hm 


  
  
cRonstrue: Library to Convert cron Expressions into Human-ReadableÂ Form â€” Given something like */5 * * * *, it'll return â€œEvery 5 minutesâ€. NoÂ dependencies.
Brady Holt 


  
  
Knip: Find Unused Files, Dependencies and Exports in TypeScriptÂ Projects â€” Being Dutch for â€œsnipâ€ is appropriate as Knip can trim away things that arenâ€™t being used in yourÂ project.
Lars Kappert 




jsPlumb 6.1
gridstack.js 8.1








ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
  
Hired 
  


  
Team Lead Web Development â€” Experienced with Node, React, and TS? Join us and lead a motivated team of devs and help grow and shape the future of our web app focused on helping millions explore theÂ outdoors.
  
Komoot 
  


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.









ğŸ¤«Â Don't tell Satya Nadella..




  








  
  
Fake Windows 11 in Svelte â€” This is a cute little side project, and the code is available too. The most common complaint Iâ€™ve seen is that itâ€™s actually more responsive than the real Windows.. ğŸ˜† Be sure to check out both â€˜VS Codeâ€™ and â€˜Microsoft Edgeâ€™ in thisÂ environment.
Yashash Pugalia 


ğŸ Prefer Windows XP? Maybe RebornXP is more for you. Complete with the classic startingÂ upÂ sound!

items.title: 'It's a miracle anything about this ecosystem works at all.'
items.content:
#â€‹637 â€” May 4, 2023

Read on the Web

Psst.. if you're wondering about the context of today's subject line, see the first âš¡ï¸Â InÂ Brief.

JavaScriptâ„¢ Weekly

Angular v16 Released â€” With the â€œbiggest release since the initial rollout of Angularâ€, v16 of the extensive framework introduces a preview of a new signals-based reactivity model (a.k.a. Angular Signals), RxJS interop, improved SSR and hydration, experimental esbuild support, Jest unit testing, andÂ more.

Minko Gechev

ğŸ’¡ See the end of this issue where Minko makes the case for Angular inÂ 2023.

Qwik Reaches v1.0 â€” In â€œother big JS frameworks that arenâ€™t Reactâ€ news, Qwik has hit a major milestone too. Qwikâ€™s selling point remains performance through serving up as little code as needed on initial page load. â€œThink of it as streaming for your JavaScript,â€ they say. Nonetheless, you get the JSX, directory-based routing, and middleware options you may be familiarÂ with.

Qwik Team

Bring Your Team from Zero to 100 Deploys aÂ Day â€” Curious about how companies such as Atlassian, Google, and Netflix deploy hundreds of times a day? What strategies do they use to achieve efficiency? This guide provides you with tips and tricks on how these companies scaled their deployments so that you can doÂ theÂ same.

Sleuth sponsor

ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Â The German Government Invests in JavaScript â€” Sort of. Germanyâ€™s Sovereign Tech Fund has made a big investment in the OpenJS Foundation, a Linux Foundation project that supports the JS ecosystem and hosts projects including Electron, jQuery, Node.js, Node-RED, andÂ webpack.

Robin Ginn (OpenJS Foundation)

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF:

  • Mark Erikson (Redux) wrote a Twitter thread about ğŸ¦ things he has to keep in mind when publishing a library in 2023 â€“ it's a lot. He summarized: "It's a miracle anything about this ecosystem works at all."

  • We plan to write about this in a future issue, but Deno KV is a new in beta key value store now baked into both the Deno runtime (as of Deno 1.33) and available in the cloud.

  • The latest VS Code release is out, with improvements to the terminal, new default dark and light color themes, support for profile templates, a built-in color picker, and support for strict nulls for JavaScript in HTML script blocks.

  • A roundup of what's new in the Svelte world.

  • Node.js can now run on every major browser engine as WebContainers now run on Safari, iOS and iPadOS, as well as Chrome and Firefox. Live demo.

  • Chrome is to replace the ğŸ”’ icon in the location bar with a vaguer 'tune'Â icon.

  • Popular app hosting platform Vercel has added three new first-class storage options for files, Postgres databases, and Redis-like key/value stores.

RELEASES:

  • Capacitor 5.0 â€“ Build cross-platform native PWAs.

  • Node.js v20.1.0 (Current)

  • pnpm 8.4 â€“ Efficient package manager.

  • React Native macOS 0.71

  • Electron 24.2

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

A Practical Guide to Not Blocking the Event Loop â€” Engines typically run JavaScript in a single thread with an event loop. However, the nature of mixing synchronous and asynchronous tasks, along with the increasing popularity of workers for running code on separate threads, makes the landscape harder to navigate than it used toÂ be.

Slava Knyazev

The Interactive Guide to Rendering in React â€” An interactive, illustrated guide exploring why, when and how React renders, complete with a series of well thought outÂ animations.

Tyler McGinnis

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, andÂ more.

Wallaby.js sponsor

The const 'Deception' â€” If the exact role of const has confused you in the past, this will be a handy primer that digs into the distinction between â€œassignmentâ€ and â€œmutationâ€ inÂ JavaScript.

Josh W Comeau

Write Better CSS by Borrowing Ideas from JS? â€” A curious look at taking best practices from the JavaScript space for writing betterÂ CSS.

Yaphi Berhanu

Crafting the Next.js Website â€” The official Next.js site is impressive, but what went into it? One of the designers shares some of the implementation details which arenâ€™t particularly React-y but may prove inspiring toÂ you.

Rauno Freiberg

Exposing a Rust Library to Node with NAPI-RS
John Murray

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

date-fns 2.30: A Modern Date Utility Library â€” Itâ€™s been a couple of years since we linked to this â€œlodash for datesâ€ thatâ€™s packed with over 200 date and time manipulation functions, but it continues to get updates and a v3 is on the way. GitHubÂ repo.

Sasha Koss

Chart.js 4.3: Canvas-Based Charts for the Web â€” One of those libraries that feels like itâ€™s been there forever but still looks fresh and continues to get good updates. Bar, line, area, bubble, pie, fonut, scatter, and radar charts are all a piece of cake to render. Samples and GitHubÂ repo.

Chart.js Contributors

Beautiful Security and License Compliance Reports for Your Appâ€™s Dependencies â€” Free & Open Source: Try the Better NPM Audit for Your AppÂ Now.

Sandwormâ€¤dev sponsor

Axios 1.4: Promise-Based HTTP Client for Browser and Node â€” A long standing project and still getting frequent updates despite rapidly being seen as the 'jQuery of HTTP request libraries.' If you need it, youâ€™llÂ know.

Matt Zabriskie

Marked.js 5.0: A Fast Markdown Parser and Compiler â€” A low-level Markdown compiler built for speed and available as a client-side library, server-side library, and even a CLI. v5.0 deprecates some options in favor of using external plugins. Hereâ€™s a liveÂ demo.

Christopher Jeffrey

Mock Service Worker 1.2: REST/GraphQL API Mocking Library â€” Intercepts requests which you can then mock. Capture outgoing requests using an Express-like routing syntax, complete with parameters, wildcards, and regexes. GitHubÂ repo.

Artem Zakharchenko

The Fastest JavaScript Data Grid Component

Bryntum Grid sponsor

Pretty TypeScript Errors: Make Errors Prettier and Human-Readable in VSÂ Code

Yoav Balasiano

next-sitemap: Sitemap Generator for Next.js Apps

Vishnu Sankar

ğŸ’» Jobs

Team Lead Web Development â€” Experienced with Node, React, and TS? Join us and lead a motivated team of devs and help grow and shape the future of our web app focused on helping millions explore theÂ outdoors.
Komoot

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

QUICK RELEASES:

  • Tremor 2.4 â€“ React library to build dashboards.

  • oclif 3.9 â€“ Node.js CLI app framework.

  • github-script 2.1 â€“ GitHub Actions workflows in JS.

  • Highlight.js 11.8 â€“ Syntax highlighter.

  • Plotly.js 2.22 â€“ Data visualization library.

  • ngx-stripe 16.0 â€“ Angular wrapper for Stripe Elements.

ğŸ—£Â A quick word from Angular's Minko Gechev

When Minko reached out to remind us of the Angular v16 launch, we decided we'd remind him that most JavaScript Weekly readers aren't using Angular (sorry Minko!) but to ask if he'd like to make the case as to why JavaScript developers shouldn't sleep on Angular in 2023. Here's what he had to say:

The problem in the JavaScript ecosystem we're solving with Angular is to provide a reliable, integrated solution that gives you all the core libraries and tools you need to focus on building apps, rather than fixing incompatible dependencies/API changes, etc. I understand that's what most technologies claim, the difference with Angular is that:

  • We're testing all core modules such as framework, router, forms, etc. on over 4,000 Google projects on every commit to guarantee stability and integration.
  • We're sharing updates in a predictable release schedule (twice a year) where we evolve everyone via the same mechanism we use to keep every project at Google to the HEAD commit on the main branch on GitHub. It's integrated as part of the ng update command of the CLI.

With the recent updates we've been:

  • Catching up with some of the use cases we were missing.
  • Advancing the performance and developer experience, while setting the foundation for more advancements throughout 2023 and 2024.

On the second point, we're expecting lots of more improvements in reactivity and SSR in the next 12 months.

So there you have it.

items.title: Did you know JavaScript is trademarked?
items.content:
#â€‹636 â€” April 27, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScriptâ„¢ Weekly

Babylon.js 6.0: The Powerful Web-Based 3D Framework â€” Babylon.js remains one of the worldâ€™s leading WebGL-based graphics engines with a visual scene builder and best-in-class physically-based rendering. v6.0 includes a new physics plugin with plenty of docs and demos, fluid rendering, major improvements to how reflections are handled, screen reader support, and more. This is a huge release of a significant project in the JavaScript ecosystem and we canâ€™t do it justice here but thereâ€™s even more on the officialÂ homepage.

Babylon.js

Handsontable 12.3: Whatâ€™s New in the Excel-Like Data Grid â€” Released recently, the popular data editor brings improved support for React 18 and large data sets. But that's not all - the team behind Handsontable has shared some cool insights about it in a new article. Check it out to learnÂ more.

Handsontable sponsor

ğŸ¦ Â Oracle's Lawyers Stir Over JavaScriptâ„¢ Trademark Use â€” Last year, we put out a call for anyone who knows Larry Ellison to pass on the word when Ryan Dahl asked Oracle to release the JavaScript trademark, but it appears little has changed with Oracleâ€™s lawyers taking a dim view of a new British company called â€œRust for JavaScript DevelopersÂ Ltd.â€

Sid Chatterjee on Twitter

Trivia: This trademark issue is why the standardized form of JS is called ECMAScript.

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ•¹ Turns out even Nintendo uses JavaScript. A developer discovered that 2015's Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Tipping Stars for the Wii U and 3DS was written with HTML and JavaScript under the hood and managed to build a shim to get it running in a normalÂ browser.

  • Chrome 113's DevTools will allow you to override network response headers, including CORS headers. It also offers Nuxt, Vite, and Rollup debuggingÂ improvements.

  • ğŸ¦ "Switching to rspack from webpack+babel has reduced our build timesÂ byÂ 85%."

  • We covered Node.js 20's release last week, but if you want to dig deeper into the new (experimental) permissions model, here are the full docs.

  • In a recent bug report on the React repo Dan Abramov noted that if you use Preact Signals with React, you forfeit any guarantee that React will work correctly and that "if React was a piece of hardware, this is exactly the kind of thing that voids the warranty."

  • A sneak peek of what's coming up in Angular 16.

RELEASES:

  • NodeBB 3.0
    â†³ JS powered forum system.

  • Ink 4.2
    â†³ Build CLI apps React-style.

  • Rspack 0.1.9
    â†³ Fast Rust-based web bundler.

  • create-svelte 4.0
    â†³ CLI for creating SvelteKit projects.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Exploring the Potential of Web Workers for Multithreading on the Web â€” Looks at the importance of Web Workers for multithreading in the browser, including the limitations and considerations of using them and the strategies for mitigating potential issues associated withÂ them.

Sarah Oke Okolo

ğŸ’¡ Partytown is worth considering if you'd like to run potentially resource intensive third-party scripts in WebÂ Workers.

Dissecting npm Malware: Five Packages and Their 'Evil' Install Scripts â€” npm related security continues to be a big topic and a common security vector is the install script thatâ€™s run when you install aÂ package.

Gabi Dobocan (Sandworm)

Automate Visual Tests with Chromaticâ€”Powered by Storybook â€” Verify visual changes and component logic on each commit. Get started with a $500 credit using codeÂ JSWEEKLY.

Chromatic sponsor

Use Fuse.js for Quick and Easy Fuzzy Searching â€” Fuse.js is a zero-dependency fuzzy search library you can use to offer search features in the browser without a dedicated search-orientedÂ backend.

Doug Shipp

Modern Alternatives to Create React App â€” create-react-app was the â€˜go toâ€™ for building single-page React apps, but this article touches on the wide variety of alternatives now in common use. (Weâ€™re on teamÂ Vite!)

Ayooluwa Aduwo

â–¶Â Â Hot Takes on the Web â€” The creator of Svelte shares his thoughts on various frontendÂ trends.

Rich Harris

How to Display a View Counter on Your Blog with React Server Components
Sebastien Castiel

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Vuetify 3.2: A Material Design Framework for Vue.js â€” If youâ€™re building a Vue.js app and would rather hand off the main design decisions to someone else, yet still have a beautifully designed app, this is the component framework for you. GitHubÂ repo.

Vuetify Team

â€œSuper stoked for all the features coming out in v3.2 today but the one that stands out most is the global defaults improvements. It makes virtual components super powerful.â€

___
John Leider, creator of Vuetify

TestGPT | Generating Meaningful Tests for Busy Devs â€” Get non-trivial tests suggested right inside your IDE, so you can code smart, and stay confident when youÂ push.

CodiumAI sponsor

Memize 2.0: Unabashedly-Barebones Memoization Library â€” The goal here is speed, and it claims to be the fastest option. It clocks in at just 0.3KB minified, too â€“Â unsurprising, since the implementation is veryÂ straightforward.

Andrew Duthie

w2ui 2.0: A Framework Agnostic UI Library â€” Somehow weâ€™d never encountered this before, but w2ui is a interesting, compact suite of common components including a grid, toolbar, tabs, and sidebar, that work with vanilla JS projects or those built with Angular, React, etc. DemosÂ here.

Vitali Malinouski

Alfaaz: The Fastest Multilingual Word Counter â€” Weâ€™ll take their.. word for it ğŸ˜ but at almost 1 gigabyte per second and support for CJK texts and Arabic and Urdu alphabets, thereâ€™s a lot on offerÂ here.

Abdullah Atta

Satori: Convert HTML and CSS to SVG â€” Designed to be used with React and JSX. It doesnâ€™t support all HTML but is designed to provide a familiar way to generate images fromÂ code.

Vercel

Add a Full-Featured Notification Center to Your App in Minutes

Courier sponsor

Linker.js: Access C, C++, Rust and Go Libraries from Node.js â€” A dynamic C-shared library linker that provides an interface for accessing any C-shared libraries (which all of C, C++, Rust and Go can produce). Linux only forÂ now.

Bitair

Editable: An Extensible Rich Text Editor Framework â€” Currently depends on React, with future plans for a plain JavaScript version. Its primary feature is that it avoids using the contenteditable attribute for better interoperability. Try it in thisÂ playground.

Editable

ğŸ’» Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profileÂ now.
Hired

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

QUICK RELEASES:

  • StatiCrypt 3.3
    â†³ Password protect a static HTML page.

  • tween.js 20.0
    â†³ JavaScript/TypeScript animation engine.

  • supercluster 8.0
    â†³ Geospatial point clustering library for browsers & Node.

  • Mercurius 13.0
    â†³ Implement GraphQL servers with Fastify.

  • htmx 1.9.1

  • Playwright 1.33
